attributes.action: Make Crown Dependencies/Overseas Territories compile public central registers
attributes.additional_details:
This would allow HMRC to accurately target those avoiding or evading their tax responsibilities.
The UK Government has in the past attempted to push some CDs and OTs to adopt a central register.
Unfortunately there has been a lot of delaying by the worst offenders for example the British Virgin Islands, the largest tax haven in the Panama Papers leak.
The UK Government has a responsibility to ensure good governance in these territories and should take whatever actions are necessary to this end.
attributes.background:
Panama Paper leaks revealed huge scale of UK involvment in tax avoidance/evasion schemes via Crown Dependencies(CD) and Overseas Territories(OT).
CDs and OTs should be made to compile, maintain and make publicly available a central register of beneficial ownership.
It is time for action.
